choices.C: Create shared contacts in the Directory using the Directory API.
choices.B: Add a secondary domain for the Partner Company and create user entries for each Partner user.
choices.A: Educate users on creating personal contacts for the Partner Employees.
choices.D: Create shared contacts in the Directory using the Domain Shared Contacts API.

What should you do?

questions.question_text:
Security and Compliance has identified secure third-party applications that should have access to G Suite data. You need to restrict third-party access to only approved applications

Your-company.com recently started using G Suite. The CIO is happy with the deployment, but received notifications that some employees have issues with consumer Google accounts (conflict accounts). You want to put a plan in place to address this concern.
What should you do?

choices.D: Use the Transfer tool for unmanaged users to find the conflict accounts.
choices.C: Ask users to request a new G Suite account from your local admin.
choices.B: Rename the accounts to temp@your-company.com, and recreate the accounts.

questions.question_text:
Your organization is on G Suite Enterprise and allows for external sharing of Google Drive files to facilitate collaboration with other G Suite customers. Recently you have had several incidents of files and folders being broadly shared with external users and groups. Your chief security officer needs data on the scope of external sharing and ongoing alerting so that external access does not have to be disabled.
What two actions should you take to support the chief security officer's request? (Choose two.)

HR informs you that a user has been terminated and their account has been suspended. The user is part of a current legal investigation, and HR requires the user's email data to remain on hold. The terminated user's team is actively working on a critical project with files owned by the user. You need to ensure that the terminated user's content is appropriately kept before provisioning their license to a new user.
What two actions should you take? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A & E
https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2736622?hl=en

comments.content:
How extending the hold on email is going to help to preserve the files owned by the user? 
B change ownership of the data does the job
E archive license allows you to keep the email hold and the files will continue to be available for the rest of the users

discussion.content: B & E .. Teams can work with files and user data will be keep with Archive user

comments.content:
B and E for me, too. 

"..HR requires the user's email data to remain on hold", so A doesn't apply because the user is just on hold and we do not need to extend it. To retain data we need an "Archive User License" then E. Cfr. https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2557687?hl=en
"If your Google Workspace administrator deletes a user, all data associated with the user's account is deleted, including data held or retained by Vault." To keep a user's data available to Vault after they leave your organization, assign them an Archived User (AU) license. ... Alternatively, you can suspend their account to preserve data and disable services, but a suspended account is billed the same as an active account." [this exclude D]

"The terminated user's team is actively working on a critical project with files owned by the user" then we can use B.

+1 for JoseLeandro and LukeSWR
 Manage former employees and data: https://support.google.com/a/answer/9048836

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
correct answer is B & E
B and E
A+E is correct
Of all the possible " Delete the account, freeing up a G Suite License." is obviously wrong. I would do A & E.

comments.content: HR requires the user's email data to remain on hold. That's why A and E

discussion.content:
A and E are correct option here 

https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2736622?hl=en
https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2473591?hl=en

choices.E: Assign the terminated user account an Archive User license.
choices.B: Move project files to a Team Drive or transfer ownership.
choices.D: Delete the account, freeing up a G Suite License.
choices.C: Rename the account to the new user starting next week.
choices.A: Extend the legal hold on the user's email data.
